text:
My bug seems to be exactly like Bug #749, but I only am getting it on Win2k.

(I'm also running the same code and build script under Linux without issue.)

If I add the classpath to the environment before running ant everything goes 
fine on Win32 - otherwise getResource() returns null.
creator: jheintz@isogen.com

text: Could you please send a testcase for this if possible ?
creator: sbailliez@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 1103
My build.xml file, pretty standard stuff.
creator: jheintz@isogen.com

text:
I've attached just my build.xml file,  I'll create a full example this weekend
or Monday (too slammed at work right now).
creator: jheintz@isogen.com
sbailliez@apache.org
text:
Thanks. We're not right to the minute so don't rush and waste all your week-end 
on this. It's just a matter of having a testcase that fails. Easier to fix and 
make sure there is no regression.

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
Could you also run ant with the -debug flag. The class loader will print out 
what it is doing when trying to load resources. You may want to attach the 
output.

creator: jheintz@isogen.com
text: Well, the "ant -debug" helped me.  Even though I am executing the ant.bat file from "C:\Programs\jakarta-ant-1.4.1\bin\ant.bat" the top of the debug output clearly says:Ant version 1.3 compiled on March 2 2001This is obviously my problem.  I need to get the config straighened out on thismachine.Sorry for wasting you time.

creator: umagesh@apache.org
text: user configuration issue.  Marking it as invalid.
